page.title: 19Farmland
page.content: The eastern part of the survey area is predominantly farmland adjoining the Rivers Clwyd and Elwy.The land is apparently fertile and is given over to mixed farming.This part of the area would appear to be farmed by approx- imately six major farmers.In one case, {Bryn Gwyn Farm}a flourishing dairy would appear to have been established, supplying many local households.In addition to grass, cereal and root crops,shhep and dairy farming would appear to predominate.During the 1960's, farmers frequently suffered heavy losses as a result of the flooding of the Rivers Clwyd and Elwy but embankments have been established in order to control this problem. In addition to the mixed farming outlined above, market gardening would appear to be a 'growing' industry in the immediate neighbourhood.
